answers.answer: Depends on type. If he was just diagnosed, I'm guessing it's type 2.  So she won't be born with it but she might be at a higher risk for it later in life. As far as your aunts and uncle, that's probably nothing to be concerned about. But I'd find out the types they are and talk to your doctor.
Just diagnosed at 28 I mean (vs as a child)
Yes he was diagnosed at age 28 years old never had problems when he was a child...

Type 1 is generally for younger people but you can be diagnosed with either type at almost any age. If he has type 1 it is possible she could get it. Usually they won't know if baby has it until much later after birth. I was diagnosed with type 1 in 2001 at 9. I'm now 22 and I know my daughter has a high chance to get it from genetics. If both sides of the family have it then look at which generations it's affected. Sometimes you get lucky and it'll skip her. I'm pretty sure it should skip my daughter but well have to wait and see
My husband has to take insulin and pills but i have no idea which one is it type 1 or type 2???

question: If my husband was diagnosed with diabetes at 28 years old can it possible that our baby girl can come out with diabetes just wondering because i'm scared!!from my mom's family  i have 2 aunts and 1 uncle that are diagnosed with diabetes but don't know what type they are???
title: My husband was diagnosed with diabetes at age 28 years old
